strings.onboardLongDescription: Witness the wildlife that have made the ultra-clean coastal waters home, from teams of dolphins and seals that are known to jump right into tour boats to the humpback whales that call Walvis Bay home during the summer and fall months.

agendaPreview.noBookingText: You don’t currently have any bookings for this day. Go ahead and fill your boots!

activities.displayName: Dazzling Dune and Desert Off-Road 4x4 Experience
activities.shortDescription: The desert comes alive on this off-road adventure
activities.longDescription: Get ready for the ride of a lifetime on this 4x4 adventure through Namibia’s dune belt. This off-road experience will have you searching for desert wildlife like geckos, lizards, and chameleons with multiple photo-ops along the way. Thanks to your expert guide, you’ll learn the topography of the desert and about the unique culture and practices of those who call it home. Ending with a quayside drive along a coastal road, this unforgettable desert adventure will leave you breathless.
highlightDetails: Scenic quayside drive back to port along a coastal road
Learn about desert life from an expert guide
Multiple desert photo-ops and chances to search for wildlife
4x4 tour of Namibia's dune belt
activities.introduction: Experience Namibia’s dunes on this off-road adventure highlighting the desert’s wildlife and wonders with plenty of stunning photo-ops along the way.
instructionDetails: Daytime temperatures can be very hot, please dress accordingly
4x4 vehicles seat up to 9 Sailors
Off-road portion may be bumpy. Sailors with back/neck conditions should use caution
Wildlife sightings are not guaranteed
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions prior to this Shore Thing

activities.displayName: Experience Pelican Point by Kayak, Cruise, and 4x4
activities.shortDescription: Discover Namibia by land and sea on a lively tour
activities.longDescription: Leave no stone unturned on this action-packed tour of Pelican Bay by land and sea. Start out traveling from quayside to the Walvis Bay Marina, where you’ll take a boat to Pelican Bay and meet your expert kayak guides. After a safety briefing and warm beverage, you’ll suit up and hit the bay to kayak around Pelican Point alongside delightful cape fur seals. Next you’ll stop for another hot bev on a remote beach before hopping in a 4x4 and returning to the quayside.
highlightDetails: Potential to kayak alongside cape fur seals
Multiple stops for hot refreshments
Cruise to Pelican Point from Walvis Bay
Kayak Pelican Point with expert guides
1-hour 4x4 drive back to quayside
activities.introduction: Experience Pelican Bay from every angle on this energetic tour. Start out kayaking with cape fur seals, stop at a private beach, then 4x4 back home.
instructionDetails: Double kayaks, single Sailors will be paired up
Sailors should consider their physical fitness level and medical history when determining whether this Shore Thing is appropriate
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Approximately 1 hour 15 minutes of kayaking
Weather may be chilly on the water. Jackets are recommended
Approximately 40 minute boat ride to kayaking location
4x4 vehicles seat up to 6 Sailors
Approximately 1 hour 4x4 drive back to the pier
Wildlife sightings are not guaranteed
Sailors need to be able to climb small ladder in/out of kayak transfer boat
Water shoes are recommended as feet may get wet in kayak

activities.shortDescription: Learn Namibian culture and meet with local tribes
activities.longDescription: Behold the rich tapestry of Namibian culture on this trip to Modesa, where you’ll meet with locals for an introduction to their music, beer, and food (including a chance to taste the famous mopane caterpillar!) This cultural exchange was created in collaboration with Virgin Voyages and the DRC Women’s Community Project. As part of this partnership, part of your tour cost is donated to the local Grow Together Kindergarten, which provides early childhood education for children around Swakopmund.
highlightDetails: Part of your tour cost will be donated to the Grow Together Kindergarten, which provides quality early childhood education to local children
Enjoy local beer, food, and music
Chance to try local delicacies like the mopane caterpillar
Cultural learning conversation with Ovaherero tribe
Walking tour of Modesa Township market
Short orientation and tour of Swakopmund
activities.introduction: Dive deeper into Namibia’s culture on this trip to Modesa with a chance to meet with local tribes such as the Oshiwambo, Ovaherero and Damara-Nama.
instructionDetails: Shade is limited and daytime temperatures can be very high. Please dress accordingly
Approximately 45 minute drive each way to/from the pier
A donation will be made on behalf of participants to the local kindergarten
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing

activities.displayName: Sandwich Harbour By Dune and Lagoon 4x4 Tour
activities.shortDescription: See the harbour by 4x4 and watch out for wildlife
activities.longDescription: Discover Sandwich Harbour’s desert on this exciting 4x4 adventure. Get your heart pumping and explore this lesser-known World Heritage site while also learning about the wetlands, lagoon, and salt works. After a drive along the ocean, you’ll traverse the dunes and take in the desert landscape. Maybe you’ll even spot wildlife like the black-backed jackal, oryx, or ostrich. After a light picnic, you’ll take in even more scenery on your way home with an exhilarating drive along the beach.
highlightDetails: Picnic lunch before returning to the pier
Learn about the Walvis Bay lagoon, Ramsar protected wetlands, and the Walvis Salt Works
Explore the dunes by 4x4
Opportunity to spot marine birds and local wildlife
30-minute 4x4 drive along the beach
activities.introduction: Sandwich Harbour’s desert comes alive on this exciting 4x4 adventure through dune and lagoon. Explore where land meets sea followed by a picnic lunch.
instructionDetails: Off-road portion may be bumpy, Sailors with back/neck conditions should use caution
Daytime temperatures can be very hot, please dress accordingly
Tour is not recommended for Sailors with a fear of heights
Wildlife sightings are not guaranteed
Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
The 4x4 vehicle will be driven by the guide
Each vehicle fits up to 4 Sailors — this is a great opportunity to make new BFFs if you're paired with Sailors from different cabins

activities.displayName: Soaring over Sossusvlei Small Plane Adventure
activities.shortDescription: Take flight over canyons, wetlands, and dunes
activities.longDescription: Defy gravity on an unforgettable flight over Namibian landscapes. You’ll get a bird's eye view of Kuiseb Canyon and Tsondabvlei, the only known breeding area for the lappet-faced vulture in southern Namibia. Next, you’ll turn towards the highest shifting sand dunes in the world at Sossusvlei and you’ll soar over old diamond mines to Conception Bay to spot seals and shipwrecks from the sky. On the way home, you’ll fly over the Namib dunes, Sandwich Harbour wetland, and Walvis Bay salt mines.
highlightDetails: Soar over multiple iconic Namibian landscapes
Opportunity to spot cape fur seals and shipwrecks from the sky
See a World Heritage Site from the sky
2-hour and 15-minute flight from Swakopmund Airport
activities.introduction: See the Sossuvlei like few before on a stunning flight over Kuseib Canyon and Tsondabvlei where you’ll spot shipwrecks and salt mines from the sky.
instructionDetails: Not suitable for Sailors with motion sickness or vertigo
This Shore Thing is weather dependent
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this tour
Maximum weight for this Shore Things is 100kgs/220lbs
Approximately 2 hour 15 minute flight
Approximately 45-minute drive each way to/from the pier

activities.displayName: Swakopmund and Walvis Bay Coast and Culture Tour
activities.shortDescription: Learn the area’s history and enjoy stunning views
activities.longDescription: This tour has a little bit of everything. Start out at Walvis Bay Lagoon for a chance to see flamingos and other birds, then take the coastal road to Swakopmund. You’ll drive along magnificent dunes, tour a Bavarian seaside resort, and take in the art nouveau architecture along the way. Once in Swakopmund, you’ll visit the famed Kristall Galerie and stroll the Mole, a beachfront promenade. End the day with free time to explore solo before a final stop at the Brauhaus Arcade for shopping.
highlightDetails: Stop for shopping at Brauhaus Arcade
Free time to roam independently
Visit the Swakopmund Museum
Visit the Kristall Galerie
Walk the beachside promenade known as the Mole
Drive to and Swakopmund via coastal road
Opportunity to spot flamingos and other bird life
activities.introduction: Bird watch, tour museums, and drive past the dunes on this tour of Swakopmund and Walvis Bay’s important historic sites with extra time to explore.
instructionDetails: The order of sites visited may vary
Approximately 45-minute drive back to port
Approximately 45 minutes of free time at Brauhaus Arcade for shopping
Wildlife sightings are not guaranteed
This Shore Thing is wheelchair accessible for collapsible wheelchairs, as well as Sailors who can navigate a few steps on their own
This Shore Thing operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria

tourDifferentiators.name: Sustainable Tours
tourDifferentiators.description: This tour operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria.

activities.displayName: Traverse the Treasures of The Namib by 4x4
activities.shortDescription: Explore one of the world’s oldest deserts by 4x4
activities.longDescription: Discover one of the world’s oldest deserts by 4x4 on this trip to Namib-Naukluft Park. After a drive through the Swakop River Valley, you’ll stop at the breathtaking Moon Landscape, where spectacular rock formations give the area an appearance similar to the moon’s surface. Next, you’ll visit the Welwitschia Valley and enjoy a light lunch at Goanikontes Oasis, an actual green paradise in the desert. Then you’ll return home via the coastal road, with dunes on one side, ocean on the other.
highlightDetails: 1-hour return drive along coastal road
Light lunch at Goanikontes Oasis
View local plant life in the Welwitschia Valley
Stop at Moon Landscape for breathtaking views
1-hour 4x4 drive to Namib-Naukluft Park
activities.introduction: Get your heart pumping with this 4x4 tour of Namib-Naukluft Park, where high-shifting dunes give way to a kaleidoscope of colors and plantlife.
instructionDetails: Off-road portion may be bumpy. Sailors with back/neck conditions should use caution
Shade is limited and daytime temperatures can be very high. Please dress accordingly
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Approximately 1 hour drive each way to/from the pier
Each vehicle fits up to 4 Sailors —this is a great opportunity to make new BFFs if you're paired with Sailors from different cabins
The guide is your driver; Sailors do not drive

activities.displayName: Walvis Bay Lagoon Cruise and Marine Life Tour
activities.shortDescription: Cruise the bay on a search for epic marine life
activities.longDescription: On this 3-hour cruise through the stunning Walvis Bay Lagoon, you’ll have the chance to experience the lagoon’s rich wildlife for yourself. From inquisitive seals swimming alongside the boat for a snack to playful bottlenose dolphins, the marine life you’ll experience on this 3-hour tour is truly unforgettable. Bird lovers will also have the chance to spot flamingoes, pelicans, and coronets, all while sipping sparkling wine and sampling local beer.
highlightDetails: Opportunity to spot flamingos (seasonal), pelicans, and coronets
Opportunity to spot seals and bottlenose dolphins
Sparkling wine, local beer, and light snacks available
3-hour cruise of Walvis Bay Lagoon
activities.introduction: Sip sparkling wine and local beer as you spot marine wildlife. Dolphins, seals, and flamingoes await on this delightful Walvis Bay Lagoon cruise.
instructionDetails: Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions prior to this Shore Thing
Wildlife sightings are not guaranteed
This Shore Thing is weather dependent
Weather may be chilly on the water. Jackets are recommended
Approximately 3 hours on the water
Animals such as seals and pelicans may board the vessel. Sailors are not permitted to touch or feed any animals
